publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: Potential years of life lost (PYLL) from causes considered amenable to healthcare (CCGOIS 1.1)
description:
Potential years of life lost (PYLL) rate from causes considered amenable to healthcare.

The following indicator includes a change of methodology for the pooled years directly standardised rate and for the confidence intervals for all breakdowns.

Full details of these changes can be found here: http://www.hscic.gov.uk/pubs/methchanges

Current version updated: Sep-15

Next version due: TBC

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: Under 75 mortality from cardiovascular disease (CCGOIS 1.2)
description:
Directly age and sex standardised mortality rate from cardiovascular disease for people aged under 75 in the respective calendar year per 100,000 registered patients.

Current version updated: Sep-16

Next version due: Dec-17

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: Completion of cardiac rehabilitation following an admission for coronary heart disease (CCGOIS 1.3)
description:

title: Breast feeding prevalence at 6 - 8 weeks (CCGOIS 1.15)
description:
The proportion of infants who are totally or partially breastfed at 6-8 weeks of age, out of the number of infants due a 6-8 week check, expressed as a percentage, with 95% confidence intervals

No further publication planned, see March 2016 publication for details.

http://www.hscic.gov.uk/pubs/ccgindmar16

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: Record of stage of cancer at diagnosis (CCGOIS 1.17)
description:
The percentage of new cases of cancer for which a valid stage is recorded at the time of diagnosis.

Next version due: Jun-18

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: Percentage of cancers detected at stage 1 and 2 (CCGOIS 1.18)
description:
The percentage of new cases of cancer which were diagnosed at stage 1 or 2 for the specific cancer sites, morphologies and behaviour: invasive malignancies of breast, prostate, colorectal, lung, bladder, kidney, ovary, uterus, non-Hodgkin lymphoma and invasive melanomas of skin.



This indicator relates to a subset of the cancers covered by CCG indicator 1.17 Record of stage of cancer at diagnosis.

Current version updated: Jun-17

Next version due: Jun-18

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: Record of lung cancer stage at decision to treat (CCGOIS 1.19)
description:
The percentage of cases of lung cancer for which a valid stage at the time of decision to treat is recorded.

2013 National Lung Cancer Audit (NCLA) based data available in archived file below.

Current version updated: Jun-17

Next version due: Jun-18

distribution.title: Archive National Lung Cancer Audit file

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: Mortality from breast cancer in females (CCGOIS 1.20)
description:
Directly age standardised mortality rate from breast cancer for females in the respective time period per 100,000 registered female patients.

The following indicator includes a change of methodology for the pooled years directly standardised rate.

Full details of these changes can be found here: http://www.hscic.gov.uk/pubs/methchanges

Current version updated: Sep-16

Next version due: Dec-17

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: All-cause mortality – 12 months following a first emergency admission to hospital for heart failure in people aged 16 and over (CCGOIS 1.21)
description:
Indirectly age and sex standardised ratio of deaths that occur in the 12 months following a person’s first emergency admission episode with a primary diagnosis of heart failure in a three year period in people aged 16 and over. A person’s first emergency admission episode is determined by selecting the earliest admission date for each unique patient identifier.

Current version updated: Mar-17

Next version due: Mar-18

title: People with diabetes diagnosed less than a year who are referred to structured education (CCGOIS 2.5)
description:

Raw data files for the most recent National Diabetes Audit publication are available here:

http://digital.nhs.uk/article/2021/Website-Search?productid=24328&q=National+Diabetes+Audit&sort=Relevance&size=10&page=2&area=both#top 

(Please copy and paste link into browser)

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: Emergency readmissions within 30 days of discharge from hospital (CCGOIS 3.2)
description:
Percentage of emergency admissions to any hospital in England occurring within 30 days of the last, previous discharge from hospital after admission; indirectly standardised by age, sex, method of admission and diagnosis / procedure.  Admissions for cancer and obstetrics are excluded.

Current version updated: Mar-14

Next version due: TBC

publisher.name: Health and Social Care Information Centre

title: Patient reported outcome measures (PROMs) for elective procedures (CCGOIS 3.3)
description:
Patients' reported improvement in health status following elective procedures, currently covering groin hernia, hip replacement, knee replacement and varicose veins. The PROMs indicator is reported separately for the four conditions.

As of September 2015 the data file now includes both primary and revision figures for hip and knee replacements from 2012/13 onwards. The ordering of the columns has also been updated, in order to be consistent with other indicators, this will affect those automatically linking to data in the CSV file.

Current version updated: Sep-17

Next version due: Sep-18
